title: NYC shooting victims honored before HOF game
content: The NFL held a moment of silence before Thursday's Hall of Fame Game to honor the four people killed earlier this week by a shooter who was targeting league headquarters in New York.

title: Correa returning to Astros, this time to play 3B
content: Carlos Correa is returning to the Astros, with the veteran waiving his no-trade clause in order to return to his previous home of seven seasons. Houston also acquired OF Jesus Sanchez from the Marlins.

title: Sources: Stanford to hire ex-Nike CEO as AD
content: Stanford is set to hire former Nike CEO John Donahoe as the school's new athletic director, sources told ESPN on Thursday.

title: Braves explode for 8, then allow 8 in historic inning
content: The Braves and Reds combined for 16 runs on 16 hits in the eighth inning Thursday night, marking just the third time in MLB history that both teams scored eight or more runs in the same inning.

title: Knicks, Bridges agree to 4-year, $150M extension
content: New York Knicks forward Mikal Bridges has agreed to a four-year, $150 million contract extension with the franchise, his agents told ESPN's Shams Charania on Thursday.

title: Dealing Pads get O'Hearn, Laureano for 6 players
content: The Padres have acquired first baseman Ryan O'Hearn and outfielder Ramon Laureano from the Orioles in exchange for six minor-league players.

title: Tiger's son step closer to Junior Ryder Cup spot
content: Charlie Woods remained in the hunt for one of two automatic qualifying spots for the U.S. Junior Ryder Cup team after shooting a 5-under 66 at the Junior PGA Championship Thursday. He's tied for second overall.

title: Who makes the Year 2 leap? The top 10 sophomores to watch for the 2025-26 NBA season
content: From top 10 picks to Year 1 breakouts, who are the most interesting players to watch in their sophomore season?

title: New Hall of Famer Antonio Gates was a beloved teammate, remains a San Diego legend
content: Gates transformed the tight end position, and he remains remarkable to those who witnessed his exploits.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Newcastle eye Woltemade
content: Both Manchester United and Newcastle United are looking to sign Stuttgart forward Nick Woltemade. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Premier League 2025-26 kit ranking: Every new jersey released so far
content: Why should you have to wait until all of the Premier League kits are out before you see them ranked? Here's every 2025-26 jersey that's been released.

title: Red Sox add to staff, acquire May from Dodgers
content: The Red Sox acquired starter Dustin May from the Dodgers on Thursday, filling their need for pitching help. Los Angeles received outfield prospect James Tibbs III in return.

title: Rangers get Kelly from D-backs to add to rotation
content: The Rangers are acquiring right-handed starting pitcher Merrill Kelly from the Diamondbacks in exchange for three pitchers, sources told ESPN.

title: Rays add White Sox's Houser, Twins' Jax to staff
content: Adrian Houser, who was released by the Rangers and has shined since being picked up by the White Sox, has now been traded to the Rays, who also picked up Griffin Jax from the Twins for Taj Bradley.

title: Phillies fill outfield need, get Bader from Twins
content: The Phillies filled a need in their outfield by acquiring 2021 Gold Glove-winner Harrison Bader from the Twins.

title: Padres acquire closer Miller, lefty Sears from A's
content: The San Diego Padres have acquired Mason Miller in a trade with the Athletics, adding the hard-throwing reliever to their already talented bullpen.

title: Mariners land slugging 3B Suarez from D-backs
content: The Mariners have acquired slugging third baseman Eugenio Suárez from the Diamondbacks in exchange for three prospects.

title: Cubs add righty Soroka, send 2 prospects to Nats
content: The Cubs acquired pitcher Mike Soroka from the Nationals for two prospects and reliever Andrew Kittredge from the Orioles for another prospect.

title: It's time for The Ocho! Check out the 2025 schedule, plus how to watch every event
content: It's time for the 2025 edition of The Ocho! Check out how to watch T-Rex races, paintball, dog surfing and more alternative events on ESPN now.

title: The real most valuable players on every NFL team: Who would return multiple first-round picks via trade?
content: This exhaustive NFL trade guide factors in ability, positional value, contracts and age to figure out which players are really worth a first-round pick.

title: Five trades that make too much sense: Which teams should make a deal now?
content: As teams look to finalize their rosters, Seth Walder proposes trades that could help all sides involved.

title: Wetzel: Next NFLPA boss should understand the job

title: How billionaire Mike Repole plans to change the vibe of the UFL, expand it to 16 teams
content: MIke Repole is taking over business operations for the UFL and promises market changes and a livelier product.

title: What to know ahead of the Hungarian Grand Prix
content: Formula 1 heads to Budapest for round 14 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the last race weekend before the summer break.

title: NASCAR taking shots in experimentation and making many of them
content: The NASCAR schedule used to be predictable. Now, though, it's constantly evolving, and the series deserves credit for its bravery.

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Taira can avoid an upset loss at UFC Fight Night
content: Din Thomas makes his pick for Taira vs. Park and a betting insider finds value bets on this weekend's MMA cards.

title: Boxing real or not: Joshua vs. Paul? Can Pacquiao win a title? Who's the best featherweight?
content: Nick Parkinson discusses what could be next for Anthony Joshua, Manny Pacquiao, Teofimo Lopez and Oleksandr Usyk.

title: Devaswom clerk suspended for stealing money during treasury counting at temple in Kerala’s Kannur
content: CCTV visuals revealed that Mullappally Narayanan of Cheriyoor, an LD clerk at the temple, stole the money

title: Disaster management mock drill carried out at 55 locations across Delhi
content: The exercise began with the triggering of a simulated earthquake scenario followed by chemical leaks in industrial and transport zones in all the 11 districts

title: Delhi CM launches month-long cleanliness drive 'Dilli ko kude se azaadi'
content: Hitting out at the previous AAP government, CM Rekha Gupta said they “spent crores of rupees on building Sheesh Mahal” but did not do anything to improve the condition of government offices.

title: Good to see Omar Abdullah enjoying visit to Statue of Unity: PM Modi
content: Jammu and Kashmir CM Abdullah posted pictures of his morning run at the famed Sabarmati River Front promenade.

title: Hot air balloon rides in Delhi in next two months, boost to ecotourism
content: The locations where hot air balloon rides will start are Yamuna Sports Complex, Commonwealth Games Sports Complex, Asita, and Baansera Park

title: The silent engine behind every cancer cure: why everyone should care about research
content: Participating in studies, advocating for research funding, donating to medical science, or simply asking doctors about the latest evidence -- these actions collectively strengthen the ecosystem that advances cancer care

title: 2018 Abirami case: How a T.N. court reasoned against death penalty for mother who poisoned her two children in Chennai: Explained
content: What was the prosecution’s case? How did the police corroborate the evidence? Did the woman confess to have committed the crime? Which of the factors convinced the trial court with respect to her guilt? What made the trial judge consciously refrain from awarding capital punishment?

title: Parole of ‘Kodi’ Suni, convict in T.P. Chandrasekharan murder case, cancelled for bail violation
content: Police say as per parole conditions, Suni should have stayed within Meenangadi police station limits. But after reporting once, he was found staying in a resort within Kenichira police limits, bordering Kannur and Wayanad

title: Centre will support highway upgrade in north Karnataka, says Belagavi MP Jagadish Shettar
content: The Union Minister told BJP MP Jagadish Shettar that the projects will be cleared on a case-by- case basis, depending on how fast the government of Karnataka moves with the projects

title: ‘Anything that moves, NASA-ISRO satellite will see with unprecedented fidelity’
content: A conversation with Karen St. Germain, director of the Earth Science Division at NASA’s Science Mission Directorate, on the ‘extraordinary new capability’ NISAR represents for ISRO and NASA

title: India cannot remain ‘mute spectator’ as institutions like WTO are destroyed, says Congress
content: Congress general secretary in-charge communications Jairam Ramesh said the World Trade Organisation (WTO) had been dealt very heavy blows during Mr. Trump-I

title: Parliament Monsoon session Day 10 LIVE: Lok Sabha adjourned till 2 p.m. amid sloganeering
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah will move a resolution on extension of President’s Rule in Manipur while Union Ports Minister will move the Indian Ports Bill, 2025 in Lok Sabha

title: AIDSO demands impartial probe into death of Odisha student at Central University of Karnataka in Kalaburagi
content: AIDSO expressed deep shock over the growing number of student deaths in Central universities and institutions of higher learning across India

title: Amarnath Yatra from Jammu remains suspended for second day on August 1
content: Over 4 lakh pilgrims have paid obeisance at the ice lingam of Lord Shiva at the 3,880-meter-high cave shrine since the 38-day pilgrimage commenced on July 3 from the Valley

title: Enforcement Directorate raids against fake call centres in Delhi duping U.S. citizens
content: Three premises in Khanpur were raided around 10:30 p.m. July 31, 2025 and the searches are still going on

title: Cambodia-based job frauds continue to haunt Visakhapatnam youth
content: In the latest case, 10 people are reportedly being forced into cybercrimes in Thailand; over 150 people from Vizag are still caught in such rackets abroad, say police

title: The fading sound of kombu
content: The sound of this wind instrument may have reverberated across  the battlefields of Tamil land. Nowadays, it is played only at temple festivals. Kombu artistes urge the government to give more aid and take steps to encourage the youth to take up the art form

title: A mango filled with unique aroma and taste and introduced by a missionary
content: The Pathiri variety is to unique to Mayiladuthurai and the surrounding areas. The name is short for Pathiriyar, the Tamil word for a Christian priest. Rev. Ochs, a German missionary and pastor of the Tamil Evangelical Lutheran Church Holy Immanuel Church, came to Mayiladuthurai in 1845. He was the first to plant the sapling of this variety

title: Over 22,000 ryots certified for cultivating organic produce in Andhra Pradesh
content: The certification has enabled the production of over 1.5 lakh metric tonnes of certified organic and good agricultural produce, unlocking access to domestic and international markets

title: Loan ‘fraud’: Enforcement Directorate summons Anil Ambani for questioning on August 5
content: The agency will record his statement under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) once he deposes, they said.

title: Tracing the naval prowess of Rajendra Chola I — from Eelamandalam to Kadaram
content: His reign marked the most assertive phase of Chola overseas ambition. The naval campaigns during this period led to the annexation of Sri Lanka and an audacious expedition across the Bay of Bengal to the distant shores of the Malay Peninsula. The defeat of Malay Peninsula earned Rajendra the title Kadaram Kondan

title: Vrikshabandhan: An annual ritual in Visakhapatnam to tie rakhis around trees
content: An annual ritual in Visakhapatnam, Vrikshabandhan involves tying rakhis to trees as a gesture of respect and commitment to preserve them

title: Workplace wellness: Sound bath therapy rises in corporate India
content: Now, work on your emotional wellbeing at the office. Companies across India, from IT to design, are adding sound baths to structured team-building exercises for employees

title: Lost song of the Sundarbans’ fisherfolk
content: Dwindling incomes from fishing and the resultant migration of fishermen to states like Kerala and Andhra Pradesh is taking a toll on the folk arts of West Bengal

title: The lives of inland fisherfolk in Tamil Nadu
content: In Southern and Western Tamil Nadu, inland fishermen use simple tools and a work ethic that does not exploit nature’s resources

title: Documentary project Recipes of the River looks at the ancient wisdom of the Goan river-fishing community
content: Photographer Assavri Kulkarni’s project assumes greater importance at a time when fish is being eaten out of season

title: In Bengaluru, meter off, fares up
content: The Regional Transport Authority of Bengaluru Urban district revised auto fares in the city limits on July 14, with the new rates coming into effect from August 1. While auto drivers are unhappy with the increase, commuters question the relevance of the decision when meters are hardly used and surge pricing by app-based aggregators is the norm

title: Review: Bride in the Hills | A Kuvempu magnum opus for the English reader
content: Set in the late 19th-century, this recent translation of the legendary Kannada writer’s 1967 novel is an exemplary work of social realism

title: Fishing in Kashmir, beneath the ice sheaths
content: Adept with harpoons in winter and nets in summer, the fishing communities here are relying on the government to save their lakes

title: Agrarian Rayalaseema’s dream for an industrial future
content: As mega industrial corridors and expressways reshape Rayalaseema’s landscape, an industrial future is poised to dawn over the region, which is grappling with declining agriculture and rising unemployment. The transformation has spurred interest in Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises among the youth, with many already scripting success. K. Umashanker speaks to the farmers who parted with their land for infrastructure development and the entrepreneurs betting big on economic boom

title: Cherlapalli terminal: All aboard the hype, but mind the gaps
content: Inaugurated with much fanfare as Hyderabad’s next big rail hub, the ₹430-crore Cherlapalli terminal was envisioned as a modern, congestion-busting alternative to Secunderabad station. But seven months after opening, the terminal remains hobbled by poor access roads, inadequate public transport, incomplete infrastructure and a disconnect between vision and execution. While the facade screams ambition, the functionality is far from future-ready, finds V. Geetanath

title: Export Facilitation Centres supporting MSMEs, says Union Minister
content: In Andhra Pradesh alone, 50 MSMEs received support through the EFCs during 2024–25, Ms.  Karandlaje said

title: In Gurugram, silence in the service lanes
content: According to those living in the shadows of the city’s high-rise structures, the ongoing raids target Bengali-speaking migrants employed in the informal sector

title: I was in love with Kavin, but my parents are ‘innocent’: Subhashini
content: According to her, Surjith wanted Kavin to meet her parents as he felt her marriage would pave way for his “progress”

title: Supreme Court dismisses anticipatory bail of IPS officer Sanjay, asks him to surrender in three weeks
content: ACB booked a case against him for ‘manipulating’ tender processes while he was Director General of A.P. State Disaster Response & Fire Services

title: False cases being filed against YSRCP leaders for questioning govt., alleges Jagan
content: The YSRCP chief calls on former MLAs — Kakani Govardhan Reddy in prison and Prasanna Kumar Reddy at his residence

title: Babulal Marandi accuses Hemant Soren government of falsely implicating Hindu leaders
content: During the monsoon session starting from August 1, the Jharkhand government will present the first supplementary budget of the current financial year as well as several bills including the University Bill-2025 in the House.

title: Gujar youth was killed in cold blood: Mehbooba
content: The killing of Parvez is part of a chilling pattern of violence, with over a dozen Gujjar-Bakerwal men dying in suspicious circumstances in 2024-25, the former CM said

title: Tusker tramples three to death in Odisha
content: Villagers allege the precise locations of wild elephants are not being communicated to them  effectively

title: Tripartite river management project between West Bengal, Bihar, Jharkhand in the works: West Bengal Minister
content: West Bengal Minister Manas Ranjan Bhunia said the proposed project aims to control soil erosion by the Ganga in Malda, close to the Bihar and Jharkhand borders

title: BSP chief Mayawati slams United States trade tariffs, urges Union govt. to use it as opportunity for self-reliance
content: United States President Donald Trump on July 30 announced a 25% tariff on Indian goods from August 1, with an additional but unspecified “penalty” for its defence and energy imports from Russia

title: CBSE delinks building of more classes from land availability
content: The construction of sections or classes will be linked to the total built-up carpet area of the school building instead of land acreage

title: Mohan Majhi Govt to plant 75 lakh saplings in a single day to celebrate birthday of PM Narendra Modi
content: Odisha CM emphasised planting of climate-resilient and fruit-bearing species, tailored to local ecological conditions

title: Rajbhar’s Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party decides to contest Bihar election
content: The two term MLA and cabinet minister in Uttar Pradesh government, Mr. Rajbhar asserted that he is in talks with the NDA but if not given respectable seats then ready to go solo.

title: No school closure, no post cuts on cards, U.P. Minister clarifies over school merger
content: The Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav claimed that the government was forced to take back the decision due to the opposition pressure and protest

title: With eye on Assembly polls, West Bengal CM hikes honorarium to community Durga Pujas by 30 %
content: The hike in honorarium to community Durga Pujas from ₹85,000 last year to ₹1.1 lakh this year comes months ahead of Assembly polls in West Bengal.

title: Himachal sees four Cabinet meetings in four days; approves OBC quota in ULB polls
content: The Cabinet meetings between July 28 till July 31 were chaired by Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu in which several decisions were taken

title: GCDA plans to transfer KK Road to Kochi Corporation after restoration work
content: While the GCDA can undertake minor repair works, such as filling potholes, large-scale restoration works and resurfacing are not feasible, unlike the Corporation, which has a separate allocation for road maintenance

title: Rights panel asks Collector to take urgent steps against over-speeding by private buses
content: District Police Chief asked to probe reasons leading to the death of a student after being fatally knocked down by bus

title: Thripunithura blast: NGT gives last chance to submit action taken report
content: The district authorities had filed a report before the tribunal stating that they were yet to receive a response from the government regarding the award of compensation, as it involved a substantial amount

title: Kochi Corporation allocates ₹5 lakh per zone to repair roads on war footing
content: Affected stretches will be resurfaced once the rain subsides, says Mayor; PWD, GIDA, GCDA, NHAI told to take action in the case of roads under their control

title: Maharashtra Minister Kokate shunted out of Agriculture Ministry following ‘rummy in House’ row
content: Dattatrey Bharne, the current Sports Minister, will be the new Agriculture Minister, said a notification issued by the General Administration Department

title: Upalokayukta calls for replication of Rayanakere waste treatment plants in other districts of Karnataka
content: Officials instructed to conduct a public impact assessment in a 5-10 km radius around waste management units to ensure that the residents in the nearby area were not affected

title: Bangladeshi model arrested from Kolkata with Indian passport
content: The development comes at a time when security agencies are cracking down on Bangladeshi nationals in different parts of the country including West Bengal.

title: Durga Puja organisers will get honorarium of ₹1.10 lakh: Mamata
content: CM’s announcement, which will cost the exchequer ₹495 cr., is a 30% increase over last year’s ₹85,000; Oppn. terms the increase a ‘bribe’

title: Tamil Nadu most resilient State, prepared to face any trade barriers, says Industries Minister
content: T.R.B. Rajaa said Tamil Nadu was prepared to face the tariffs even before Donald Trump was elected as the U.S. President

title: Doctors’ association urges government to act on paraquat poisoning
content: The Healthcare Reforms Doctors Association urges the Telangana Government to take action against paraquat poisoning, proposing strict regulations and safety protocols for herbicide use

title: SHElterTech launched in Hyderabad
content: The project is an initiative under the ShelterTech platform, co-led by WE Hub and TSIC- Habitat for Humanity

title: How not to identify an illegal immigrant
content: People are being detained by the police simply because they speak a certain dialect or wear a particular garment

title: SC informed of Kerala NoC to tree-felling, court asks Centre to verify
content: A Bench headed by Justice Surya Kant asked the Centre to verify the information and consider providing the necessary environmental clearance

title: Karnataka Food Safety and Drug Administration shifts focus to trans fat reduction in cooking oil
content: The Commissioner of Food Safety and Drug Administration highlighted the link between trans fat and non-communicable diseases, such as heart disease and cancer, urging the food industry to adopt healthier practices

title: Trump Tariffs LIVE Updates: Indian Markets Drop As US President Donald Trump's Tariff Sweep Offsets Earnings
content: Donald Trump Tariff LIVE Updates: US President Donald Trump on Friday unveiled an array of import levies that ranged as high as 41 per cent on Syria and included a hike on Canadian imports from the current 25 per cent to 35 per cent.

title: Probe Agency ED Raids Fake Call Centres In Delhi Duping US Citizens
content: The Enforcement Directorate has conducted searches in Delhi as part of a money laundering probe against a "fake" call centre which allegedly duped US citizens by pitching sale of "pirated" software, official sources said Friday.

title: "Highly Satisfying Moment": ISRO Chief To NDTV On NISAR Satellite Launch
content: India and the US launched the NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar Satellite (NISAR) - the most expensive civilian Earth observation satellite ever built - on Wednesday.

title: In Fresh Probe Against Anil Ambani, Rs 68 Crore Fake Bank Guarantee Charge
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has widened its ongoing investigation into alleged financial irregularities involving the Anil Ambani Group, launching a parallel probe into a fake bank guarantee case worth Rs 68.2 crore, NDTV Profit reported.

title: Rain, Thunderstorms Likely In Delhi For Next 3 Days: Weather Office
content: The national capital is expected to witness a fresh spell of rain over the next three days, as IMD has forecast light to moderate showers accompanied by thunderstorms between Friday and Sunday (August 3).

title: Differences With India Can't Be Resolved Overnight For Trade Deal: US Official
content: Differences between the US and India cannot be resolved overnight to arrive at a trade deal, a senior US official told reporters late on Thursday, citing geopolitical disagreements.

title: Hot Air Balloon Rides Coming Soon To Delhi: Locations, Timeline, Other Info
content: Delhiites may soon get a bird's-eye view of the capital, with hot air balloon rides set to launch in the coming months at multiple sites across the city.

title: 90% Of Farmers Fund Used To Fuel Cars, Not Crops In Madhya Pradesh: CAG
content: Rs 4.79 crore, that is 90 per cent of Fertilizer Development Fund in Madhya Pradesh was spent on vehicles, drivers' salaries, and maintenance at state and district levels.

title: 'Ended 1 Conflict A Month': White House Demands Nobel Peace Prize For Trump
content: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt reiterated the call for the Nobel Peace Prize to be awarded to the US President.

title: Trump Releases Revised Tariffs: India Remains At 25%, Pak's Rate Slashed
content: US President Donald Trump has signed a new executive order slapping higher tariffs on dozens of trading partners ahead of a Friday trade deal deadline, in his latest bid to reshape global trade in favour of US businesses.

title: Telangana Cyber Fraud Busted, 4 Arrested With Over 230 SIM Cards
content: A joint operation led by the Telangana Cyber Security Bureau (TGCSB), the Department of Telecommunications (DoT), and the Ramagundam Commissionerate Police has successfully dismantled a cyber financial fraud setup operating in Jannaram in Telangana

title: Probe Agency ED Summons Anil Ambani In Loan Fraud Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned Reliance Group chairman Anil Ambani on August 5 for questioning in connection with an alleged Rs 3,000 crore worth bank loan fraud-linked money laundering case.

title: "India An Ally, But Can't Align 100% Of Time": US On Trump Tariffs
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio on Thursday said that India's purchase of oil from Russia is "most certainly a point of irritation" in New Delhi's relationship with Washington.

title: Kamala Harris To Detail 2024 US Presidential Run In New Book
content: Former US vice president Kamala Harris on Thursday announced she will provide an inside look at her unsuccessful 2024 presidential run against Donald Trump in a book titled "107 Days."

title: Elon Musk's Starlink Gets Satellite Internet Permit In India
content: Elon Musk-led Starlink has received a licence to launch satellite service in India, and a framework for spectrum allocation is also in place for a smooth rollout, Union Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said on Thursday.

title: "Good To See...": PM Modi Lauds Omar Abdullah's Statue Of Unity Visit
content: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday expressed happiness over Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah enjoying his visit to Gujarat, and said his visit to the Statue of Unity will inspire fellow Indians to travel to different parts of the country.

title: US Tariffs India Highlights: "Will Take All Steps For Nation's Interest": Piyush Goyal On Trump's Tariff Shocker
content: US Tariffs On India LIVE Updates: Hours after announcing 25 per cent tariffs on Indian imports, US President Donald Trump has hit out at New Delhi and its trading partner Moscow.

title: Trump Announces New Tariffs: From India To Pak - Who Pays What Now
content: President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday imposing reciprocal tariffs ranging from 10% to 41% on U.S. imports from dozens of countries and foreign locations.

title: Trump Says Russia's Actions In Ukraine "Disgusting"
content: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday sharply criticized Russia's "disgusting" behavior against Ukraine and said he plans to impose sanctions on Moscow if no agreement can be reached.

title: Trump Increases Tariff On Canada To 35% Ahead Of Trade Deadline
content: Trump has warned that any country that does not strike a deal with the U.S. before Friday will be subjected to higher tariffs imposed on goods.

title: BSF jawan goes missing in Srinagar; search operations on
content: A Border Security Force jawan is missing. Sugam Choudhary is from the 60th Battalion. He was last seen at the battalion headquarters in Srinagar. Extensive searches are underway in nearby areas. Security forces have launched a large-scale operation. Police sources say there is no subversive angle. He may have left due to personal reasons. The investigation is ongoing.

title: Watch: Andhra minister’s brother slaps cop at temple; arrested
content: During a temple inauguration in Andhra Pradesh's Nandyal district, BC Janardhan Reddy's brother, Madana Bhoopal Reddy, slapped a police constable on duty. The incident, captured on video, triggered public outrage and led to Bhoopal Reddy's arrest. Minister Janardhan Reddy condemned the act, assuring that those responsible would face legal consequences, emphasizing the government's intolerance for such behavior.

title: 'No support in male-dominated society': Divya becomes India’s 4th female GM; but why so few?
content: Divya Deshmukh's Grandmaster title highlights a gender disparity in Indian chess. Only four Indian women have achieved this rank, compared to over eighty men. Experts cite societal pressures, lack of support, and financial constraints as key factors. They emphasize the need for inclusive policies, coaching, and financial aid. This will encourage more women to pursue chess professionally.

title: How Amazon's 'AI mistake' is a basic lesson for every engineer
content: An Amazon Gen-AI coding tool, Q Developer, faced a security breach where a hacker infiltrated it with malicious code disguised as a legitimate update. This allowed the hacker to instruct the tool to delete files from users' computers. The incident highlights vulnerabilities in AI-driven software development, as many organizations using AI for coding do so in risky ways.

title: 25% on India, 19% on Pak, 35% on Iraq: Full list of US tariff rates announced by Trump
content: US President Donald Trump has implemented a revised trade tariff regime under his “America First” policy, effective August 7. It imposes a default 10% tariff on 68 nations and the EU, with higher rates for countries with trade deficits, starting at 15%. Syria faces the highest tariff at 41%.

title: After denied debut in 5th Test, India pacer Arshdeep poses with family in London - see pic
content: India's team selection for the final Test against England at The Oval sparked debate, especially regarding Arshdeep Singh's continued absence despite regaining fitness. While Arshdeep remained patient, Kuldeep Yadav and Abhimanyu Easwaran also awaited their opportunities. Ultimately, India opted for a pace-heavy attack, reflecting the recent dominance of fast bowlers at The Oval, as they aimed to level the series.

title: ED summons Anil Ambani on August 5; loan diversion charge being probed
content: The Enforcement Directorate has summoned Anil Ambani on August 5 concerning a loan fraud case amid bribery and unsecured loan allegations. This action follows ED raids at over 35 locations in Mumbai, investigating the diversion of approximately Rs 3,000 crore in loans granted by Yes Bank to Ambani's group companies between 2017 and 2019.

title: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff says: I keep asking CEOs, what AI are they using..
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff disputes predictions of AI-driven job losses, asserting that AI primarily enhances human capabilities, despite Salesforce's own automation initiatives. He highlights AI's accuracy limitations, emphasizing the ongoing necessity of human oversight for fact-checking and strategic decision-making. Benioff anticipates AI will fuel a surge in small business creation by democratizing access to enterprise-level tools.

title: IND vs ENG: Nair earns plaudits for sportsmanship, stops for injured Woakes
content: During the India versus England 5th Test, Karun Nair displayed sportsmanship when Chris Woakes injured his shoulder while fielding. Nair refrained from taking an extra run out of respect. Woakes' injury appears serious, potentially ending his series. Gus Atkinson expressed concern and readiness to step in. Woakes has had a challenging series, taking only 11 wickets.

title: Gold price: Outlook for August 1; why 'sell on rise' strategy makes sense?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold futures are facing pressure, struggling to recover, currently around ₹98,778. Technical indicators suggest a weak rebound, lacking bullish momentum. Experts advise a 'Sell on Rise' strategy near ₹99,000, with a stop-loss at ₹99,450, targeting ₹98,550 and ₹98,200. The trend remains vulnerable to declines until prices decisively break above the 21 EMA with strong volume.

title: 'One peace deal per month': White House pushes for Nobel Prize for Trump
content: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt asserted that President Trump brokered numerous peace deals, averaging one per month, and deserves the Nobel Peace Prize. Leavitt cited a ceasefire between Thailand and Cambodia, highlighting Trump's intervention and threat of halted trade negotiations. However, India has refuted Trump's claims of resolving conflicts with Pakistan, emphasizing bilateral resolutions.

title: Not a single person has accepted the offer: Murati on her team rejecting Zuckerberg’s $1 bn offer
content: Meta's aggressive pursuit of AI talent faced a significant setback as Thinking Machines Lab, led by Mira Murati, reportedly rejected lucrative offers, some reaching a billion dollars, to join Meta's Superintelligence Lab. Murati's team prioritized independence and long-term vision over substantial financial gains, highlighting the allure of shaping AI's future outside a corporate giant.

title: CAT 2025 registration begins: Check direct link to apply online here
content: The CAT 2025 registration window is now open at iimcat.ac.in from August 1 to September 13. The exam, scheduled for November 30, is a gateway to IIMs and top B-schools. Candidates must register online, upload required documents, and pay the fee. Admit cards will be available from November 5, 2025.

title: No F-35 jets from US for India? Govt mulls next steps after 25% tariff shock
content: India is exploring options to address US President Trump's 25 per cent tariff on Indian goods, but immediate retaliation is unlikely. While aiming to maintain trade relations by potentially increasing imports of natural gas, communication equipment, and gold from the US, India has ruled out new defense purchases, including the F-35 fighter jets.

title: Heartfelt top 50 messages for your girlfriend on national girlfriend day
content: National Girlfriend's Day, celebrated on August 1st, honors the profound connections between women, emphasizing friendship and mutual support. It's a day to appreciate the women who uplift and stand by you, whether they are best friends or romantic partners. The celebration focuses on female connection, offering thoughtful messages to express gratitude and love for the women who enrich our lives.

title: UP IAS officer transferred 36 hours after sit-ups video goes viral
content: IAS officer Rinku Singh Rahi, known for his integrity and past exposure of a major scam, faced a swift transfer just 36 hours after assuming office as SDM in Shahjahanpur's Powayan. This followed a viral video showing him doing sit-ups as a symbolic gesture regarding public sanitation.

title: Yuzvendra Chahal recalls LAST conversation with ex-wife Dhanashree Verma
content: Yuzvendra Chahal addressed his divorce with Dhanashree Verma. He spoke about the viral T-shirt he wore during the proceedings. Chahal said the shirt was a response to something from Dhanashree's side. He mentioned a financial agreement was in place before the final decision. The couple agreed to keep their issues private on social media.

title: US visa logjam: Indian students stuck in the waiting room; will Marco Rubio open the door?
content: A bureaucratic visa bottleneck has left thousands of Indian students stranded ahead of the Fall 2025 semester, as U.S. consulates in India slash appointment slots amid new digital vetting rules. Despite bipartisan pressure on Secretary of State Marco Rubio to restore processing, the crisis threatens U.S.–India educational ties, economic contributions, and America's global image as a welcoming academic destination.

title: Rummy row: Maharashtra minister loses agri portfolio, gets sports, minority affairs
content: Following a rummy controversy, NCP leader Ajit Pawar reassigned Agriculture Minister Manikrao Kokate to Sports and Youth Welfare, Minority Development, and Waqf. Dattatray Bharne will now head the agriculture department. This demotion followed Kokate's apology for the incident and assurances of improved behavior.

title: IND vs ENG: Gavaskar slams poor Jaiswal - 'There’s a bit of uncertainty'
content: Sunil Gavaskar has voiced concerns about Yashasvi Jaiswal's batting technique after his recent dismissal in the fifth Test. Gavaskar highlighted flaws in Jaiswal's footwork and shoulder positioning, impacting his ability to handle inswinging deliveries. India's top order struggled, leaving them at 204 for 6, needing a lower-order fightback to post a competitive total.

title: Stock market: Sensex down over 100 pts; shares weighed down by US tariffs
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Friday as India braces for 25% tariff rate on its exports to the US. While Nifty50 went below 24,750, BSE Sensex was down over 100 points.

title: 13-year-old's burnt body recovered in Bengaluru: Parents got late-night ransom call
content: A 13-year-old boy, Nischith A, was tragically found murdered in south Bengaluru after being abducted on Wednesday evening while returning from tuitions. His partially burnt body was discovered on Bannerghatta-Gottigere Road, following a ransom call to his parents.

title: Bangladeshi model held with fake Indian papers; here's how she got Aadhaar
content: Shanta Pal, a 28-year-old Bangladeshi woman and former airline crew member, has been arrested in Kolkata for allegedly possessing fake Indian identity documents. Pal, who also worked as a model and food vlogger, had been living in Kolkata with her parents on a valid passport.

title: Why did Trump hike tariff on Canada from 25% to 35%?
content: President Trump has escalated trade tensions by imposing a 35% tariff on Canadian imports, citing concerns over fentanyl and Palestine's statehood recognition. This action, effective August 7, excludes goods under the US-Mexico-Canada agreement and includes a transshipment levy.

title: States of emergency for New York & New Jersey: Key points
content: A powerful storm wreaked havoc across the US East Coast, prompting states of emergency in New York and New Jersey. Torrential rain transformed streets into rivers, crippling transportation and stranding commuters. New York City Mayor Eric Adams issued a travel advisory, urging residents to stay indoors.

title: Bihar polls: Nitish Kumar rolls out fresh sop; education workers' pay increased
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has announced a doubling of honorariums for education workers, including cooks, night watchmen, and physical education instructors, ahead of the upcoming assembly elections. This move aims to boost morale and dedication by increasing monthly salaries and annual increments.

title: Watch: Unbelievable! 41-yo AB de Villiers pulls off stunning last-ball heroic
content: AB de Villiers, at 41, showcased his brilliance in the World Championship of Legends semifinal, securing a thrilling 1-run victory for South Africa against Australia with a stunning last-ball run-out. Despite a quiet batting performance in the match, de Villiers has been a dominant force throughout the tournament, leading the run charts with two centuries.

title: Watch: Trump’s awkward attempt at pronouncing Tua Tagovailoa’s name goes viral
content: During a White House event, President Trump mispronounced Tua Tagovailoa's name while announcing the quarterback's appointment to the Presidential Council on Sports, Fitness, and Nutrition. Despite the verbal stumble, Trump praised Tagovailoa's resilience, highlighting his comeback from injury. Tagovailoa's connection to the Trump family, including his wife's support and interactions with Ivanka Trump, adds another layer to his prominent role.

title: 'Was fighting lunatics like you': Trump slams reporter over tariff question - watch video
content: During a White House press conference, President Trump clashed with a reporter, labeling him a "lunatic" for questioning the timing of invoking the IEEPA to impose tariffs. Trump defended his actions, citing previous tariffs on China and accusing the media of inadequate coverage.

title: ‘Hopefully, Alireza can kick Carlsen’s a**’: Nakamura after semifinal loss
content: In a thrilling Esports World Cup 2025 chess semifinal, Magnus Carlsen edged out Hikaru Nakamura 4–3, reaching the final after an Armageddon showdown. Nakamura, despite a strong King's Indian Defense win, narrowly missed victory. Carlsen will now face Alireza Firouzja for the top prize, while Nakamura competes for third place.

title: DMK councillor’s grandson arrested for ramming Loyola student to death in Chennai
content: In Chennai, three individuals, including Chandru alias Chandrasekar, grandson of a DMK functionary, have been arrested for the murder of Nithin Sai, a Loyola College student. Nithin Sai was killed in a deliberate car ramming incident following a dispute over a romantic relationship involving a female student. The police are searching for another suspect involved in the crime.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for August 1 - check list
content: Bajaj Broking Research suggests that Nifty will consolidate between 24,500-25,000, while Bank Nifty is expected to rise towards 57,500-58,300. Amidst US-India trade tensions and RBI rate decisions, Axis Bank is recommended for purchase between Rs 1050-1070, targeting Rs 1175. Larsen and Toubro is also a buy, within Rs 3590-3640, with expectations to reach Rs 3963.

title: Triple H entertains White House with signature spit move: Watch
content: WWE legend Triple H, also known as Paul Levesque, recently joined President Donald Trump at the White House for the revival of the Presidential Fitness Test. Levesque's signature water spit entrance on the White House steps went viral. Trump praised Triple H's influence as they aim to combat declining youth fitness by reintroducing structured physical education in schools.

title: IND vs ENG, 5th Test: Overcast sky, green pitch, moving ball - welcome to England, Day 1
content: The first day of the fifth England-India Test at The Oval favored England, with India struggling to 204/6 on a spicy, bowler-friendly pitch. Rain interruptions and inconsistent bowling, barring Gus Atkinson, added to India's woes. Despite Karun Nair's resilient fifty, aided by Washington Sundar, India's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate hopes they can reach 300, praising Sai Sudharsan's patient innings.

title: Crude calculations: Trump's oil deal with Pak - a move to counter China, pressure India?
content: Donald Trump's announcement of a deal to develop Pakistan's oil reserves is viewed with skepticism. Experts suggest it's a strategic move to counter China's influence and pressure India on trade, rather than a reflection of Pakistan's immediate hydrocarbon potential. The viability of these reserves remains unproven, requiring significant investment and time, especially given the risky locations.

title: As Bengaluru techies flock to office, traffic worsens
content: Bengaluru's tech sector faces increased traffic congestion on Outer Ring Road, worsened by job insecurity and fear of layoffs. Employees are prioritizing office presence, leading to a 20-45% rise in vehicular flow at tech parks. Traffic police propose work-from-home on Wednesdays, while commuters emphasize the need for improved infrastructure to alleviate the gridlock.

title: Is Yuzvendra Chahal dating RJ Mahvash? India cricketer clears the air
content: Indian cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal has addressed rumours linking him to RJ Mahvash after his divorce from Dhanashree Verma. He clarified he is not dating anyone and needs time to heal, expressing fear of future heartbreak. Chahal explained that photos with Mahvash were misinterpreted, leading to online trolling and false accusations against her.

title: 'I just wanted to ... ': Chahal explains viral 'be your own sugar daddy' tee during divorce saga
content: Yuzvendra Chahal has opened up about his divorce from Dhanashree Verma and the story behind his viral T-shirt. Speaking on a podcast, Chahal revealed the emotional distress he faced and his decision to wear the “be your own sugar daddy” T-shirt as a message. He clarified that the divorce was a gradual decision, influenced by career pressures and differing goals.

title: Cong vs Cong: Rahul backs Trump’s ‘dead economy’ remark; Tharoor, Shukla contradict him
content: Amidst Rahul Gandhi's endorsement of Trump's "dead economy" remark, Congress leaders like Rajeev Shukla and Shashi Tharoor offered differing perspectives. Shukla refuted Trump's assessment, emphasizing India's economic strength and past reforms. Tharoor viewed US tariffs as a potential bargaining tactic during ongoing trade negotiations, urging support for negotiators while acknowledging potential damage to exports if a favorable deal isn't reached.

title: Justin Timberlake's Lyme disease diagnosis: “When I first got the diagnosis, I was.."
content: Justin Timberlake recently revealed his Lyme Disease diagnosis, explaining the challenges he faced during his 'Forget Tomorrow' tour. Despite experiencing debilitating symptoms like nerve pain and fatigue, Timberlake chose to continue performing, driven by the joy he derives from connecting with his fans. He shared his reluctance to disclose his health struggles initially, aiming for transparency and to prevent misinterpretations.

title: Travis Hunter leads Madden NFL 26 rookie ratings
content: EA Sports has released the initial ratings for the NFL's rookie class . the top ten rookies as rated by Madden NFL 26 are the Jacksonville Jaguars cornerback Travis Hunter . Hunter claims the top spot with 84 OVR, sporting high general stats .

title: Wrexham celebrate Wales' connection with Argentina in stunning third kit
content: Wrexham return to the second tier of English football in 2025-26 . the club are just one step below the premier league . a new kit has a distinct inflection of world cup holders Argentina .

title: EA Sports details major solo play changes for Madden NFL 26 Ultimate Team
content: upcoming iteration's Ultimate Team mode will feature a 12-game gauntlet every week . it will be the primary stomping ground for players to tackle challenges with escalating difficulty . the new Solo Champions mode is aimed at making MUT more attractive .

title: PLL Power Rankings entering Week 10: Chaos jump into Top 3
content: the Denver Outlaws and New York Atlas were the first two teams to clinch 2025 playoff spots . they will also face the Chaos on friday (8 p.m. ET, ABC/ESPN+), who rose up my Power Rankings this week . there isn't a weakness on this team and they share the rock .

title: Former Cubs outfielder Matt Szczur pays tribute to Ryne Sandberg with painting
content: former Chicago Cubs outfielder Matt Szczur paid homage to team icon Ryne Sandberg . his most recent project was a tribute to a Hall of Famer who died on Monday at 65 . he has built up a following on Instagram and TikTok (19,200 followers)

title: Mets find CF fix, trade for Orioles veteran Mullins
content: the Mets acquired center fielder cedric Mullins from the Baltimore Orioles . the 30-year-old is set to be a free agent after this season . he's hitting .229 with 15 home runs and a .738 OPS in 91 games for Baltimore .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Texas Tech's big moves land it in the top 25
content: at least four top-50 prospects are expected to make announcements over the next month . the top classes could see some more big changes before week 1 kicks off . OT Keenyi Pepe has double-digit ESPN 300 commits, with several joining the list .

title: Free agency Power Rankings: Where the Rockets, Raptors and others land
content: the 2025-26 offseason is in full swing . some teams are settling in with their newly acquired superstars . the Houston Rockets acquired 15-time All-Star Kevin Durant from the Phoenix Suns in June . other veteran names were also on the move this offseason .

title: 🏈 CFB's toughest and easiest schedules for '25
content: college football is for the first time in history sharing revenue with athletes . the start of the 2025 season is less than a month away . it's time to hand out some superlatives, some flattering and some not so flattering .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Jags' Thomas, Lawrence working on connection
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL, and our 32 team reporters are on the ground each day following all the action . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room .

title: Insurance RB rankings: Charbonnet, Guerendo lead the way
content: Zach Charbonnet is a priority insurance running back for fantasy managers . this concept applies to fantasy football . he was rostered in just 22% of ESPN leagues entering Week 1 . but he emerged as a league winner after the Buccaneers' week 11 bye .

title: MLB trade deadline recap: Correa to Astros and all the moves that rocked deadline day
content: the 2025 trade deadline has officially passed, with contending teams making a flurry of late moves before 6 p.m. ET arrived . the San Diego Padres made a blockbuster move ahead of deadline day with a late-night deal with the Arizona Diamondbacks for Eugenio Suarez .

title: Nunez, Grealish among Premier League stars who need a transfer
content: the start of the 2025-26 premier league season is just two weeks away . the summer transfer window is about to enter its final month . a drop down to less glamorous or successful club could be the best option . click here for all the latest premier league news .

title: MLB trade deadline winners and losers: What we loved -- and don't understand
content: this year's deadline didn't have star players on the move, like Juan Soto in 2022, or the volume of last year . we did have two shocking trades: the Astros brought back former star Carlos Correa . the Athletics traded closer Mason Miller to the Padres for leo de Vries .

title: Source: Commanders' McLaurin requests trade
content: a source says Terry McLaurin has requested a trade . he was frustrated with negotiations on a contract extension . there has been no movement toward a new deal, one source says . the commanders receiver could no longer be fined $50,000 per day .

title: Maha polls: Tests prove EVMs tamper-proof; 'no mismatch between count, slips'
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‘prime’ political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India’s neighbourhood.
